item.title: Dsal | 21 processes with minors between 2022 and 2024
item.description:
Between 2022 and 2024, the government registered 667 minor employment contracts involving more than 1,300 young people. The main areas of employers are hospitality, restoration and commerce, for table employees and retail sales. In the same period, 21 cases were raised for violations of the law that regulates the work of minors
Between 2022 and 2024, the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL) reported 667 cases of hiring minors, involving 1,333 young people. The director of the public organism that manages the labor questions, Wong Chi Hong, revealed in response to a written interpellation of Deputy Lei Chan U that the hires of young people, between 16 and 18 years old, were mainly for the sectors of hotel, restoration and trade by thick and retail. The main jobs that performed by smaller workers are “table employee” and “retail sales employee”. The director of DSAL also indicated that during the same two years, "in total 21 processes related to minors, mainly related to the violation of the admission requirements of minors and the non -compliance with the duty of communication by employers." Following these 21 processes, Dsal made the “monitoring of the offenses committed”. Wong Chi Hong did not disclose whether the employers in question were held responsible or sanctioned by the offenses. GAME RULES MSAR legislation allows hiring minors between 16 and 18 years old, but establishes safeguards that allow the balanced physical and psychic development of adolescents. There are admission requirements, works that are prohibited or conditioned to minors, guarantees of health protection and employer duties, the DSal director indicates. The presentation of a medical certificate that proves that the young man has physical and psychic abilities appropriate to perform the functions to be performed, as well as a written authorization of his legal representatives. In addition, it is the employer to present to DSAL, within 15 days from the signature, “the copy of the contract, the medical certificate and the written authorization of its legal representatives, except in the situation of hiring for work during summer school holidays”. According to official data, in the third quarter of last year, there were 14,200 workers aged 16 to 24, among which 10,900 were residents. In response to written interpellation, the DSAL director did not reveal how many of the minors who work have resident status.

item.title: Geogostronomy and the role of Portuguese cuisine in Macau
item.description: (continuation) Kitchen chiefs are increasingly experiencing melting dishes that incorporate international flavors, remaining faithful to Portuguese roots. The emergence of new gastronomic trends, such as “farm-to-table” and sustainable cuisine, reflects the growing awareness of the origin and quality of food. Social networks have also transformed the way culinary experiences are shared and perceived. Platforms like Instagram have made it easier for bosses to show their dishes to a global audience, attracting food enthusiasts and contributing to the promotion of macanese cuisine. Through visually appealing presentations, bosses may involve customers and encourage the appreciation of intricate flavors of Luso-Macaense cuisine. Several academic analyzes of Macau's geogostronomic landscape reveal the complex interaction between culture and food. Scholars emphasize the concept of identity, illustrating how culinary practices reflect the cultural heritage and values ​​of the community. The mix of Portuguese and Chinese culinary traditions creates a distinct identity for Macao, reinforcing its position as a cultural cauldron. The investigation suggests that gastronomic experiences are vital to fostering a sense of belonging among residents and promoting community ties. The culinary events and festivals that celebrate Luso-Macaense gastronomy further reinforce the community's involvement and promote a shared cultural identity, encouraging pride in local traditions and values. The role of Portuguese cuisine in Macau is ready for continuous evolution. The growing awareness of consumers for sustainability and health will probably shape culinary trends. Kitchen heads may prioritize the use of local and organic ingredients, while exploring innovative cooking techniques that honor traditional practices. Promoting educational programs that emphasize the importance of culinary heritage can help ensure that future generations enjoy and continue the tradition of Portuguese gastronomy. By promoting connections between chefs and consumers, Macau can maintain his unique cuisine in a constantly changing global landscape. The role of Portuguese gastronomy in Macau serves as a rich example of how cultural and geographical factors intertwine to shape culinary practices. As Macau sails for contemporary influences and anticipates future developments, the essence of Portuguese cuisine continues to prosper and evolve, promising a vibrant and dynamic culinary future. The evolution of macanese culinary culture is also influenced by the change in consumer habits and globalization. The increase in gastronomic tourism in Macao led to a greater interest in traditional dishes, as visitors eager for experiencing local flavors exploit the gastronomic landscape. Restaurants can respond by raising traditional recipes to exquisite gastronomic experiences. Events such as the “International Festival of Cities of Gastronomy, Macao” also promotes the appreciation for local cuisine, drawing attention to the skills of local bosses and the importance of culinary heritage. In recent years, conscious effort has been assisted to preserve traditional methods, simultaneously integrating modern techniques and global influences. The introduction of elements such as molecular gastronomy begins to be a practice in various luxury restaurants in Macao, creating a new dialogue between traditional dishes and contemporary food science. These innovative approaches challenge the notion of authenticity, suggesting that tradition is not static but dynamic. While there are purists who advocate the preservation of original revenues, others advocate a reinterpretation that reflects contemporary food and preferences. The sustainability of Macanese cuisine in the modern context is another critical area to examine. Environmental awareness began to influence culinary practices, with an increasing emphasis on the use of local ingredients. This change improves the freshness of foods served in Macanese restaurants. Establishments are increasingly highlighting their commitment to ecological practices and can integrate in their sustainable seafood menus and organic vegetables. These practices ensure that although the kitchen remains rooted in its historical context, it continues to evolve in a sustainable way. In addition, the intersection of global trends had an impact on Macao's traditional culinary landscape. The global fascination with the melting kitchen encouraged bosses to experience unconventional combinations. This mixture of culinary traditions can be seen in the popularity of dishes such as the Macaense-Taieman lobster curry or almond cookies influenced by Portuguese and Chinese pastry techniques. These developments reflect the evolution of the taste of both local inhabitants and tourists, reflecting a broader culinary narrative that challenges traditional concepts of what constitutes macanese food. The future of Macanese cuisine seems promising, characterized by continuous exploration of identity, innovation and cultural exchange. As the culinary scene evolves, it is crucial that chiefs and gastronomy enthusiasts find a balance between respect for traditional methods and the adoption of new techniques. The potential for greater international recognition remains strong, particularly in the field of exquisite restoration, where macanese flavors can be presented with modern interpretations. However, challenges persist, namely as regards the preservation of authentic culinary practices. Discussions may arise around cultural appropriation as macanese dishes gain popularity and are adapted to various culinary contexts. The challenge lies in ensuring the maintenance of the integrity of traditional dishes and at the same time interacting effectively with a global audience. This dialogue enhances the delicate balance between adaptation and authenticity in culinary heritage. Macau's Portuguese cuisine represents a rich tapestry of flavors formed through centuries of cultural exchange, innovation and adaptation. The historical context provides a basis for understanding how these diverse influences intertwined, leading to a distinct culinary identity. Influential heads have defended this kitchen, ensuring its relevance in modern gastronomy, while sustainability efforts aim to keep it linked to local traditions. The interaction between tradition and modernity, authenticity and innovation will continue to shape the future of Macanese cuisine. The enthusiasm surrounding this culinary landscape promises to attract global interest, immortalizing the flavors and narratives that define this unique gastronomic heritage.

item.title: Improve the economy of Macau (i)
item.description: After Sam Hou Fai took office as the Chief Executive of Macao, he repeatedly expressed the desire to improve the region's economy, promoting moderate sector diversification and correcting the situation that leads to the game industry to master the city's economy. Macao has positioned itself as a leisure city, but its tourist model is changing 'traditional sightseeing' to 'immersive tourism' and there are many closed stores on the city streets. According to data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services, there were 42,996 industrial and commercial spaces closed in June 2020. In December 2024, this number rose to 43,343. These data show that the economy has not yet completely recovered after the pandemic and that the work of the Macao government at the level of economic development has become difficult. To stimulate the vitality of Macao's economy and benefit more residents of the city, several people argue that tourism should focus on the community rather than forwarding visitors to tourist attractions. Thus, the sales of stores in community areas can be increased, allowing more people to have access to tourism revenues and reducing the number of closed commercial spaces. Already part of this plan is the increase in the number of check-in points on Fulong Street and the appearance of many stalls in Coloane who sell top of gamma products. But how can we lead tourists to consume in the community? Some say that this objective can be achieved through concerts. The process would organize free transportation to take people who visit community tourist locations to the concert room. One of the reasons why Macau can successfully host these events is the fact that Hong Kong concert halls are always full. Macau can take the opportunity and provide alternative places. The concerts attract crowds so they are a great way to bring many tourists to Macau. Currently, some travel platforms, in collaboration with concert organizers, sell tickets, in packages that include stay at the hotel, meals, transportation and other items. The package is cheaper than if purchases were made individually. This model reduces the cost of travel to Macau and can increase tourists the desire to consume in the city. If the project is enriched with tourist bus services to allow visitors to access directly to tourist sites in the community areas, naturally the possibility of consuming local commerce will increase and this will be a way to stimulate Macao's economy. To achieve this goal, first it is necessary to ensure the success of the concert. Organizers have to sign a contract with the artists. But if there is more than an artist acting, you need to be very careful. The case that occurred with Messi, which was supposed to have played in Hong Kong, but ended up not playing, made the Raehk government have noticed that besides making a contract with a team, if they do not make individual contracts with all participants, the coming of some of them can be endangered. Messi's episode inspired Macau. When a concert is organized, in order to be sure that the fears that call the most public will be present, it is necessary to sign separate contracts to ensure the presence of them all. Without this provisions, there is a possibility that some of these stars fail the concert. After ensuring the presence of the star, the next step is the transportation organization for viewers. Should this bus be a traditional tourist bus? Due to the current tendency of immersive travels, tourists apparently prefer normal buses to experience the city's daily life. Perhaps the society of Macao may have this innovative idea, that is, to use the macao public transport buses to perform this tourist service. These vehicles would take visitors to community tourist sites and could transport local tourists and residents. In this way, tourists would not only have the feeling of traveling in a vulgar bus, but the number of tourists who expect in transportation and congested local buses would also be reduced. And this should be taken into account because tourists carry luggage that takes up a lot of space. Tour buses would only travel between concert sites and community tourist areas. The number of passengers would be relatively low and each would have enough space, which increases comfort. The decision that these trips are paid or free must fit the carrier company. What will be the next step after guaranteeing concerts and tourist buses? Will tourists consume in community areas? We will give the answer next week. item.title: Sam Hou Fai and Wu Sui
item.description: Everyone knows who Sam Hou Fai is, but Wu Sui, does anyone know who it is? I believe not only most Portuguese, but also many Chinese have never heard this name. However, in Chinese society, especially in Macao where popular beliefs are preserved, Wu Sui is an important figure because it is an “guardian deity” of the year of the serpent, responsible for supervising the happiness and misfortune of the human world. Wu Sui was born in China 800 years ago during the Song Dynasty and served as a magistrate in Xuning County. During his mandate, Wu Sui exposed many hidden crimes and the neighboring neighbors often sought their help and advice to solve difficult cases. One year, there was a great drought and Wu Sui prayed in the temple for three days and three nights and ended up raining. To relieve the drought's impact on the people, Wu decreed the tax reduction and the rental of the land, providing help to 48,000 victims of this disaster. At that time, more than 400,000 refugees from other affected areas crossed the river to Xiuning and Wu Sui did all possible to help them. While other cities were immersed in chaos due to incidents of agitation, set fire, and withdrawals motivated by drought, the areas governed by Wu Sui remained peaceful and orderly, without anyone creating any problem. Therefore, it is not without reason that popular tradition elected Wu as the guardian divinity in the year of the serpent. Due to the current complex and constantly changing international developments, it is believed that 2025 will be a year that happens once in every century and will have to face great challenges. Although crises and opportunities are hand in hand, not all leaders know how to “recognize change”, “respond to change” and “seek change”. Recently, Xia Baolong, the director of Hong Kong and Macau's work office and the Hong Kong and Macau Staff Office with the Council of State, visited the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin, the Hetao Shenzhen-Hong Kong (Hetao Innovation Zone) Zone), Modern Service Industry Zone between Qianhai district in Shenzhen and Hong Kong and the port of Yantian, where he was deeply involved in talks with employees responsible to strengthen cooperation between Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau and to promote the best of these cities in the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay area. Hong Kong and Macao, in conjunction with Guangzhou and Shenzhen, were once seen as the four engines of the development of the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay. However, due to several factors, Hong Kong is still in the “transition from stability to prosperity” while “1+4” diversification in Macau is, for now, in an embryonic phase. If the Government of the MSAR cannot deal with cautious diversification, it will not be able to produce synergies in the Greater Guangdong-Macau Bay, but, on the contrary, the status of Macao will be at risk as a potential international financial center and as a world center of tourism and leisure. Therefore, director Xia is very concerned about the future development of Hong Kong and Macao. Since Sam Hou Fai took office as chief executive, it is believed that his habit of “walking on the streets” has been changed, becoming more complicated for him to learn about the difficulties that the local population faces every day, related to the lack of employment and the closure of stores due to the breach of consumption. In addition to the fall in property prices, the cost of living is constantly increasing and radio programs are often heard from people asking the social risk value and old age pension to be increased. The beautiful idea of ​​“integration of Macao and Hengqin” cannot improve the current living level of short -term Macao residents. In the next lines of governing governing for the financial year of 2025, I sincerely hope that the government is actually concerned with the issues with which citizens have to deal with daily. Sam Hou Fai passed from the judge of the last court, the Chief Executive, while Wu Sui moved as a magistrate to be a guardian deity of the popular tradition. However, both were confronted with the challenge of finding solutions to relieve the difficulties that people have to face.

item.title: FRC | Saturday is “Tours with History” at Centro Kun Iam
item.description:
The Rui Cunha Foundation promotes this Saturday, from 15h, another edition of the initiative “Tours with History”, which are more than guided tours of places of historical or cultural interest of Macao with accompanying some expert. This time, it is up to sculptor Cristina Leiria, author of the project of the Kun Iam Ecumenical Center, to organize the visit
Saturday is the day of another edition of the initiative “Tours with History”, organized by the Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC), which promotes guided tours, in Portuguese and English, to Macao places with historical and cultural interest. This time the tour starts at 3 pm to the Kun Iam Ecumenical Center, and is led by Portuguese architect and sculptor Cristina Leiria, author of the original project inaugurated on March 21, 1999, recently renewed and reopened on December 11, 2024. The Kun Iam Ecumenical Center was a project designed by the author, with the support of UNESCO, “aiming to perpetuate mutual respect and friendship between all peoples and civilizations,” according to the IC official page. The public art complex measures 32 meters high in total, 20 of which refer to the bronze statue of the goddess Kun Iam, which weighs 50 tons. “The base of the statue, in the form of lotus flower, consists of the contemplation room where one can rest, listen to music and read. In the decoration of the summit the artists of Macau, Kwok Woon and Joana Ling painted, on rice paper, figures, symbols and texts related to Lao Tse, Confucius, Mence and Buddha, ”says IC information. The lower floor offers a multipurpose room, with a capacity of 50 people, dedicated to concerts, conferences, movie viewing and other multicultural activities, such as art exhibitions. Active exposure Currently, there is the individual exhibition of Cristina Leiria, “moments of light with kun iam”, at the invitation of the IC to mark the conclusion of the restoration and conversion work in a multipurpose cultural tourism space, 25 years after the author's presence at its inauguration. The show, which extends until March 13, displays statues of the goddess Kun Iam and other associated works, in materials such as Jade, Crystal, Wood or Brushed Steel, and is complemented by images and videos that portray the process of design and construction of the ecumenical center, making known to the public behind the scenes of your planning and building. Born in Lisbon on April 25, 1946, Cristina Rocha Leiria lived in Mozambique between both and 17, when she returned to study architecture at the Higher School of Fine Arts, and later took a specialization course at University College in London. He deepened studies on Feng Shui, in Macao, China and Japan, and electromagnetism in France, having exercised in such different places as the United Kingdom, Mozambique, Rhodesia, South Africa, Portugal and Macao. The construction of the Kun Iam Ecumenical Center was a challenge launched by the then governor of Macao, Vasco Rocha Vieira (recently deceased), which is a space where silence has a place to exist in a specific place. The statue dedicated to the goddess Kun Iam is 20 meters high and is made of bronze, having plenty of spiritual meaning for most Orientals.

item.title: Cinema | Selected 13 documentaries and shorts in contest

item.title: Cinematheque | First Indian Film Festival marks early March
item.description:
Cinemateca Paixão hosts on March 1st and 2nd the first Indian film festival of Macao. The poster, promoted by the Consulate General of India in Hong Kong and Macau, features titles such as “Dangal”, with the great star of Indian cinema Aamir Khan, “Hellaro”, and “Zindagi at Milegi Dobara” and “RRR”
Bollywood movie lovers, based on romantic stories, with adventure and a lot of dance, will have two days to see some films of this industry, starring the big stars of Indian cinema. In an unprecedented initiative in the territory, the first Indian film festival takes place at the Passion Cinematheque on the weekend of March 1 and 2, with the organization of the Consulate General of India in Hong Kong and Macao and support from the Association of Indian Culture in Macao, chaired by Vitor Kumar. The festival starts with the movie “Dangal”, starring Aamir Khan, which will be screened between 10am and 1 pm March 1. The film mixes sports and action, telling the story of the former wrestling fighter Mahavir Singh Phogat, who passes the teachings of this sport to his daughters, Babita and Geeta. The young women won the 2010 Commonwealthy games, becoming two well-known fighters throughout India, winning the silver and gold medals in this mode respectively. "Dangal" debuted in 2016. Also on March 1, between 15h and 17h, "Hellaro" will be aired, a "story that tells the journey of a woman to freedom through dance", describes the organization. Dating from 2019, the film portrays the story of a woman who is trying to overcome herself, facing the most diverse challenges to get what she wants. The second day The Indian Film Festival continues on March 2, this time with the screening of “Zindagi at Milegi Dobara”, a film centered on the story of three childhood friends who make a three -week trip in Spain. The tour ends up changing the perceptions and ideas they had from life to date, gaining new ideas about friendship and love. The screening of the film runs between 10:30 and 13h. item.title: Exhibition | “Show-off 3.0” shows works by three local personalities
item.description:
This Wednesday is inaugurated the exhibition “Show-off 3.0”, promoted by the Vila da Taipa Cultural Association, which presents a new concept of show: instead of exhibiting works of an artist, art pieces acquired by local personalities are revealed. This time the choice falls on the pieces of Lúcia Lemos, Carlos Morais José and Rita Machado
The Vila da Taipa Cultural Association presents, from this Wednesday, a new exhibition. This is “Show-off 3.0”, which as the name implies is the third edition of a show of local collectors, that is, what is presented to the public are works of art of Macao personalities or residing in the territory, rather than exposing the work of an artist. Thus, “Show-off 3.0” has pieces acquired by Lúcia Lemos, founder of the Creative Macau Gallery; Carlos Morais José, director of HM and author; and Rita Machado, architect. This project is born after verifying a “cultural influence brought to the community by the first exhibition of the series”. According to a statement from the organization, this trio of personalities "shares the impressive collections that have accumulated over the years, both local and international, including works of art that adorn the most intimate spaces of their homes." In this show, “ideas related to art collecting, aiming to promote collecting as a cultural good that starts from an individual initiative, but can also widen the sense of community, foster its vitality and add diversity to local economies”. The organization of this exhibition considers that collecting art also enhances the commerce itself in this segment, besides “fostering local and international talent”, and in “Show-off 3.0”, as in the other editions, “aspects of the collector's personality” are revealed. Frames so I want you Lúcia Lemos, who for years has been at the head of Creative Macau, presents “a collection composed mainly by vibrant and colorful paintings of local and foreign artists”. “Lúcia Lemos has been involved in promoting local artists for over two decades, through the interpretation of various means, including painting, graphic design, 3D art, photography and cinema. She is also a director of the International Short Festival Shortages Sound & Image Challenge since 2010. Being a plastic artist herself, who has developed her abilities in black and white photography and video, her special relationship with the images results from the many years of exposure to the artistic environment of the Portuguese city of Porto, ”says the organization. Following is Carlos Morais José, a degree in Anthropology, but always dedicated himself to journalism, being director of HM for several years. In addition, he founded several publishers, namely Cod and Books do Meio, and the latest literary edition project is the publisher “Grão-Fala”, based in Lisbon, with the focus of editing works on Chinese and Asian culture in Portuguese. He is also a poet and author. “Carlos Morais José's collection refers to a subtle and complex relationship between a scholar and a gongshi who sees stones-rocks with a particular aesthetic beauty-which at the uncooked look seem to be just decorative stones, but that leads the sneelful to look into issues that transcend his appearance,” he describes. Rita Machado, architect linked to the Atelier Impromptu Projects, presents works of art that are based on "in relationships she has maintained with many local and international artists, and with some of which has established lasting friendships." Rita Machado “is interested in the intersections between Western and Eastern culture, urban design and architectural design”, having graduated in architecture at the University of Porto with the thesis “Macau, City (In) Finite”. João Ó, architect and president of the Vila da Taipa Cultural Association, described that it is “an honor to invite three art collectors to show its various art collections in Vila da Taipa, after the success of our experimental exhibitions in the last two years”. "This rare and special exposure aims to explore the nature of collecting and raise visually stimulating conversations about the cultural possessions of individuals with very specific and highly personal interests," he said. The show can be seen until April 30, intending to “further reinforce the position of Taipa village as one of the main cultural and artistic destinations of Macao, underlining its invaluable contribution to the promotion of the cultural and creative industries of the territory”.

item.title: Firefighters | Investigated for falsifying attendance records
item.description:
A head of an operational station is being investigated for leaving Macao at the same time as it sting the point and said it was working
The Public Prosecution Service (MP) is investigating a head of an Operational Post of the Fire Department (CB) for the crime of “falsification committed by an employee”, which may entail a five -year imprisonment. The information was released yesterday by the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), who conducted a preliminary investigation. According to CCAC, the investigation took place due to a complaint, received last year about the attendance of the head of the operational post, who despite chopping the point was absent from work. Following the investigations, the CCAC concluded that "the chief in question was absent from the region twice, between December 2023 and May 2024, during the time of service or during the complementary work period." In addition, on three other occasions "he was absent from the operational post for more than an hour," then returning only to "chop up the point, falsely claiming that during the periods concerned, he was providing complementary work." From the perspective of CCAC, this conduct of the Firefighter had the “intention to hide false situations of comparison to the service”. The head of the post risks responding criminal for the crime of forgery committed by an employee, who has a penalty expected from one year to five years in prison. If the final penalty applied is less than three years may be suspended. In addition to criminal investigation, the CCAC has reported that succeeded to the Fire Department “for proper follow -up”, which should mean the existence of an internal disciplinary proceedings. In the statement, the CCAC also warned “the civil service workers” to be “aware and comply with the law”, having requested more rigor in the self -discipline of the “agents of authority”. General concerns In turn, the CB issued a statement to declare it to be "very concerned about the incident" and revealed that it "immediately instituted a disciplinary process against the offender." In addition to accompanying the case of the firefighter, the internal supervision instructions were also updated and there will be an “exhaustive review of the procedures and advisory control guidelines” to avoid similar cases. This is not the first case of falsification of attendance in recent years by security workers. In 2023, another CCAC investigation concluded that the chief of a customs post and six subordinates had falsified the attendance records to avoid penalties for early delays or exits from work. The case, which also began from a complaint, was more elaborate than presented yesterday, since it involved the duplication of the presence cards, so that the point could be bitten by other employees.

item.title: Economy | Retailers fell 14.9% in 2024
item.description: Last year, the turnover of retail trade establishments had a reduction of 14.9 percent compared to the previous year, according to data released yesterday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). Last year, retail business volume reached 71.99 billion patacas, with reductions that extended to supermarkets. Among the main types of retail trade, the volume of watch and jewelery has a 25.3 percent reduction, which means a quarter of the entire business volume. In the sale of leather items the reduction was 22.6 percent and in the 18.6 percent warehouses and trinkets. At the supermarket level the value was practically stable, but there was still a 0.2 percent reduction at the annual level. At the opposite pole, the sales volume of new automobiles has a 16.1 percent growth. In the comments collected by DSEC to retail establishments, compared to the first quarter of this year, 54.4 percent predict the decrease in annual sales volume, 39.1 percent anticipate stabilization and 6.5 percent project increases in sales volume. item.title: IC | Suspended filming that caused 12 people running over
item.description:
The Cultural Institute considers that the conduct of the producers has undergone public order, safety and tranquility, after being ignored by the authorities not to record a scene with a car circulating at high speed
The Cultural Institute (IC) announced the suspension of the license attributed to the recording of a film in the territory that resulted in the run over 12 people. The case happened on Monday, when a scene with a car at high speed was being filmed on the seminary street. The production team responsible for the film was accused of not following guidelines from the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP). "The Cultural Institute summoned an interdepartal meeting and, based on the opinions of various services, issued a notice of suspension of the project license to the filming entity, as the filming team did not fulfill the relevant requirements during filming," was informed, through a statement issued on Tuesday at the end of the night. "At this time, the filming entity cannot perform the project filming activities in Macao and later, the IC will require the filming entity to deliver a report, not excluding the revocation of the filming authorization warning," he was added. The IC acknowledged that before approving the authorization for the recordings had access to the script and classified the "content of filming" as "complex". And in a meeting prior to filming, such as different services, it will have informed producers who could not record scenes with high speed cars in that place: “At the meeting [approval of the authorization], the competent services have expressly expressed that this place is unable to shoot the vehicle to the drift. Representatives of the filming entity learned of opinion of approval services, ”was reported. Several heads At the Tuesday meeting that resulted in the suspension of the license also participated CPSP, the Directorate of Services for Traffic Affairs (DSAT), the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) and the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL). "Based on the opinions of various services, the IC immediately issued a warning of the project's filming license because this project is suspected of causing obvious disorders to public order, safety or tranquility, and the filming entity may not at this time make the project's filming activities in Macao," he was justified. Regarding the damage caused to public facilities, the IC pointed out that "the competent services will follow the case." Prior to the statement, also on Tuesday, CPSP organized a press conference and announcing that the instructions issued had not been followed by the producers, as it had been established that the site was not suitable for high speed road circulation. The accident happened on Monday afternoon, on Seminary Street, when a car used to record a chase scene lost control and reached 12 people. The injured were taken to Kiang Wu Hospital, all with slight injuries, and were discharged on Tuesday.

item.title: China | EN, SHIPS MAKES TWO DEAD AND 14 MISSING
item.description: At least two people have died and 14 are missing after a clash between a passenger boat and a petroleum waste recovery vessel in downtown China, Chinese press said yesterday. According to Chinese official news agency Xinhua, the accident occurred around 10:00 am on Tuesday on the Yuanshui River, which crosses the city of Qinglang, when the two vessels crashed, causing the passenger boat to come and sink. As a result, all 19 people on board fell into the water. To date, the rescue teams recovered two bodies and managed to save three people, who were hospitalized and are in a stable state. Another 14 passengers remain missing. Rescue operations continue with more than 60 rescue teams and at least 10 highlighted vessels. The Ministry of Emergency Management and the China Ministry of Transport have sent specialized teams with sonars and divers to intensify searches. Authorities have opened an investigation into the causes of the accident, although to date no details have been disclosed about the circumstances of boarding.

item.title: Taiwan | Beijing accuses Taipei of manipulating incident with Cabo Submarino
item.description: The Chinese government yesterday accused Taipei of manipulating Beijing's alleged involvement in the recent rupture of a submarine cable that connects the main island of Taiwan to the fisherman's archipelago. State Council's Taiwan Cabinet spokesman Zhu Fenglian described the incident at a press conference as a “common maritime accident” and accused Progressive Democratic Party authorities (DPP), “exaggerating and deliberately politicizing” the incident without clarifying “the facts and responsibilities”. The ship allegedly involved in the incident, identified as Hong Tai, of Togo Flag, with eight Chinese crew members on board, was associated with China by the Taiwan Coast Guard, which fed the tensions between the two governments. However, the spokeswoman stressed that “more than a hundred similar incidents happen every year around the world”, minimizing the importance of the incident. "This kind of political manipulation is unpopular and will not gain public support," said Zhu, referring to the position of the Taiwanese authorities. The deputy accused the DPP of trying to take "political advantage" from the case, a strategy that, according to Beijing, will not be successful. Taiwan currently has 14 international and ten domestic submarine cables, according to the Taiwan National Security Office, which estimated that the island is an average of seven to eight cable cutters per year. The incident occurred around 3:00 am on Tuesday, when CGA received a report from Chungwha Telecom, Taiwan's largest telecommunications company, indicating that the third submarine line that connects Taiwan to fishermen if he had left about six nautical miles northwest of the southern Jiangjun port. Chungwha Telecom stated that there was no "any impact" on communications services after rupture.

item.title: HK | Disneyland records record of entries and profits
item.description: Hong Kong's Disneyland ended nine years of damage by announcing the highest annual affluence and the highest net income since the opening of the theme park in 2005, thanks to the return of Chinese tourists. Net profit reached $ 838 million from Hong Kong in the last year fiscal year, which ended in September, Disneyland Hong Kong on Tuesday announced. Park revenues increased 54 percent to US $ 1.1 billion. In addition, the number of visitors reached a maximum historical of 7.7 million and the expenses by visitor grew 28 percent. “Hong Kong Disneyland Resorts has achieved the best commercial performance ever in the history of the complex (…). It remains one of the main engines of tourism, ”said the company's executive director Michael Moriarty in a statement. The Hong Kong theme park is the smallest Disneyland in the world and fought for years to establish itself before reaching profitability in the early 2010 decade. The company then faced fierce competition after Shanghai opened a Disneyland in 2016. The losses worsened when the park was closed for months during the Covid-19 pandemic. The entry of local visitors, Chinese from the interior of the country and international tourists exceeded last year the levels of 2018, said the company. The local inhabitants represented about 40 percent of visitors, a slice similar to that of tourists from the interior of China being, the remaining from Taiwan, Philippines and Thailand. The opening of a section based on the successful animation movie “The Snow Queen” in November 2023, “constituted an important milestone,” noted the company. The complex is preparing “Marvel Thematic Experiences” and will organize events to celebrate the 20th anniversary in June, Hong Kong's Disneyland said.

item.title: New Zealand | China expects to “reinforce mutual understanding”
item.description: Chinese vice president Han Zheng said yesterday that the country attributes “great importance” to the development of bilateral ties with New Zealand and expects to “reinforce mutual understanding”, in a meeting with the New Zealand Vice-Prime Minister Winston Peters. Peters' visit to China occurs after Beijing has reached an agreement with the Cook islands, criticized by New Zealand, and the NeoZelaland Defense Minister claimed that Chinese war ships have sailed in waters near New Zealand and Australia over the past two weeks with "extremely capable" weapons. "The comprehensive strategic partnership between China and New Zealand is entering its second decade," said Han, quoted by the official news agency Xinhua. The official added that China attributes "great importance to the development of relations with New Zealand." According to Han, Beijing is willing to work to “implement the important consensus achieved by the leaders of both countries, improve mutual understanding and promote sustained, solid and stable development” of ties. The Chinese vice president recalled that the leaders of the two nations gathered on the sidelines of the meeting of APEC economic leaders last November, providing "strategic guidelines for the continuous development of relationships from a new starting point." Peters, who accumulates the position of Foreign Minister, said New Zealand is willing to “reinforce dialogue, improve understanding and deepen economic and commercial cooperation” with China, according to Xinhua. According to a statement from the Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman, China seeks to “improve mutual understanding and expand economic cooperation” between the two countries in areas such as solar energy and electric vehicles.

item.title: Technology | Shenzhen invests 21 billion euros by 2025
item.description: Shenzhen, southeastern China, which concentrates several technological giants in the country, announced yesterday that it will invest 160 billion Yuan in technology throughout 2025. The amount will be spent on “New Type Infrastructure” to allow the city to “fully compete” on emerging sectors such as Artificial Intelligence (IA), said Mayor of Shenzhen, Qin Weizhong, at the local government's annual summit, which began on Tuesday. The report presented by the mayor puts the economic growth target for this year at 5.5 percent, along with other objectives, such as the creation of 200,000 new jobs. Shenzhen is part of the Great Bay area project - a world metropolis, built from Hong Kong and Macau, and nine cities in Guangdong Province, through the creation of a single market and growing connectivity between roads, rail and sea roads. Guangdong has stipulated as a goal to grow 5 percent this year, although in the last three years it has not achieved its objectives in the context of a slowdown of the Chinese economy, and despite being the most exported Chinese province. The city of Shenzhen faces growing competition from other major Chinese technology centers, including Hangzhou, which is based on emerging companies such as the DeepSek AI platform and the UNITEE Robotics company. Once a fishing village located on the Hong Kong border, Shenzhen has become a global base for the manufacture of electronic products and headquarters of the country's main technological firms, such as the Huawei telecommunications group, the BYD electric automobile manufacturer or the Tencent Internet giant after China opened the market economy in the 1980s.

item.title: Beijing criticizes US arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: China yesterday criticized the sale of weapons from the United States to Taiwan, while one of its leading leaders promised more efforts to meet, coinciding with Beijing military maneuvers off the southern coast of the island. According to the spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Lin Jian, China will “firmly defend its national sovereignty, territorial security and integrity” and be “vigilant” if Donald Trump administration releases $ 5.3 billion from previously frozen foreign aid, which would include $ 870 million to Taiwan. "The US military aid to Taiwan seriously violates the" one China "principle, the Sino-American sets and sovereignty and the security interests of China, sending a seriously wrong signal to the separatist forces that defend" Taiwan's independence, "said the spokesman. Taiwan's issue is one of the main points of discord between Beijing and Washington, as the US is the main arms supplier to Taipei. "We urged the United States to stop Armar Taiwan and mine peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait," Lin said. Appeal to reunification Quoted by Official News Agency Xinhua, Wang Huning, “number 4” in the Communist Party hierarchy yesterday appealed to “more efforts on the cause of Chinese 'reunification', during a working meeting on Taiwan. "China must firmly maintain its right to dominate and take leadership in relations between the two margins of the Strait, and probable the cause of the 'reunification' of the homeland," Wang said to the party's staff. He added that China must "firmly support the island's patriotic and unified forces" and, at the same time, "suppress the provocative acts of those who promote" Taiwan's independence ", in order to" shape the inevitable tendency of reunification. " "We must promote exchange and cooperation between the two margins of the Strait, support the coming of entrepreneurs and entities from Taiwan to mainland China and deepen the integration between the two parties," he said. China must “oppose firmly and lock out external interference” and “consolidate the adhesion of the international community to the“ one China ”principle”, which considers Taiwan as an inalienable part of Chinese territory and Beijing as China's only legitimate representative in the world.

item.title: USA | Xi Jinping asks for calm in the face of the climb of the trade war
item.description:
The Chinese leader warned of the need to calmly respond to changes in the international trade staff promoted by the new US administration
The Chinese president called on the Communist Party yesterday to respond to “calmly” to the “challenges brought by changes in the domestic and international situation” in a period of worsening commercial tensions with the United States. "We must reinforce our political abilities and calmly respond to the challenges brought by these changes," said Xi, during a party's work meeting, according to the Chinese Official News Agency Xinhua. The Chinese leader has asked the regime staff to strive to "further deepen reform, expand high level opening, promote sustained economy recovery, constantly improve people's living level and ensure social stability." The meeting takes place one week before the annual session of the National Popular Assembly, China's maximum legislative agency. The statements also appear at a time when the trade war is intensified with the United States. Xi Jinping asked employees to join the “general party tone” to “make progress, maintaining stability”. "Our new concept of high quality development should be implemented in full and flawed," he said. Xi added that employees should improve their "ideological awareness" and adopt "a correct view of political achievements." “We will strictly apply the regulations of our central committee to conscientiously comply with our political responsibility. We have to act, fulfill our duties and overcome difficulties, ”he said. Hands in the pockets In January, Beijing responded to the rates imposed by US President Donald Trump-10 percent on imports from all Chinese products-at a rate of 10 percent to 15 percent over certain US products, as well as new export controls of essential minerals and an investigation against the Google American technology giant. China has also protested against the latest US rates of 25 percent on steel and aluminum imports, as it exports these materials to other countries, such as Canada and Mexico, which in turn sell them to the US.

item.title: South Korea | Central Bank reduces interest rates due to poor growth
item.description: South Korea Central Bank yesterday reduced interest rates by 0.25 percentage points to 2.75 percent a month after reviewing the forecast for economic growth. The cut takes place after the Korea Bank (Bok) had kept the reference rates unchanged in December and was the third reduction since October. This after the Central Bank had kept the interest rate on the rise for four years and five months, for fear of the high levels of inflation left by the Covid-19 pandemic. In the monetary policy report for 2025, the South Korean Central Bank said new rate cuts aim to "maintain the moderate pace of inflation growth," as well as "mitigating risks to the economy." In the document, Bok promised to be more attentive to avoid any volatility in the financial markets, in the midst of the uncertainty caused by the return to power in the United States of Donald Trump. The prospects for South Korea exports are more modest after Trump's reelection, which promised to impose tariffs on imports, including the automotive industry, one of the key sectors for the South Korean economy. Yesterday's decision stressed Bok's policy focus on economic growth, as on January 20, the institution had reviewed the forecast for growth in 2025 of Asia's fourth largest economy from 1.9 to 1.5 percent. "The unexpected statement of martial law in early December, along with the continuous political instability and disaster of the Jeju Air passenger plane, significantly affected economic sentiment," the Central Bank underlined. The accident and the political crisis "led to contractions in domestic consumption and investment in construction, which probably pushed the fourth quarter growth rate well below the November projection," said the Central Bank.

item.title: North Korea Delegation arrives in the Russian capital for an official visit
item.description: A high-level delegation from the North Korean single party arrived in Moscow for an official visit to the party's party invitation in Russia, the North Korean state press said yesterday. The delegation of the North Korean Workers Party, led by Ri Hi-Yong, a member of the North Central Committee Politburo, landed in the Russian capital on Monday after an invitation from the United Russian Party, the official North Korean news agency KCNA said. Andrey Klimov, a member of the United Russian Party Supreme Committee and deputy chief of the party's foreign activities, received the North Korean delegation to his arrival at the airport, KCNA said without further details. The visit occurs at a time when the United States began negotiations to end Russia's Ukraine invasion, which has been supported by thousands of North Korea troops on the ground. New US President Donald Trump said on Monday that the priority was to reach an agreement to end the war in Ukraine, although he was open to a ceasefire as a preliminary step for deeper negotiations. Since signed a mutual defense treaty last year, Pyongyang and Moscow have reinforced bilateral cooperation in defense, economy, sports and various other fields. Historical moment Relations between North Korea and Russia, which share only 20 kilometers of border, were intensified in mid-2024, with Russian President Vladimir Putin's first visit to Pyongyang since 2000. According to South Korean, Ukrainian and Western sources, Pyongyang provided Moscow large amounts of ammunition in exchange for the transfer of civil, spatial and military technology. In addition, both countries have signed a strategic treaty that provides for mutual military assistance in case of aggression and more than 10,000 North Korean soldiers will have been sent to Russian territory to combat Ukrainian troops in the Russian border regions.

item.title: Cristina Ferreira, jurist and professor at the University of Macau: “Faft was in the right place and moment”
item.description:
Cristina Ferreira, an expert in international law, investigated the legal status of the “International Financial Action Group”, which fights money laundering and terrorism financing. In the book “The Legal Status of the Financial Action Task Force in the International Legal System”, the jurist discusses the undefined legal status of the body that got great power worldwide
What are the main reasons for the creation of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF)? The FATF emerges within the scope of the G7 in July 1989, largely at the United States of America (US), to respond to the crime of laundering of capital trafficking and the United Nations Convention against illicit trafficking and psychotropic substances of 1988. Common guidelines and the coordination of preventive measures, especially in the financial level and international cooperation. 40 international recommendations were elaborated against the laundering of capital ”. Today FAFT has 40 members, 38 jurisdictions, the European Commission and the Gulf Cooperation Council. The last member, Indonesia, entered 2023. These members represent industrialized countries, large financial squares and emerging economies. How to evaluate, over the years, the performance of the FATF? He played a very important role of leadership after September 11, 2001. Suddenly, the fight against terrorism (FT) became an international obligation and priority on the agenda of all countries. In the international level, the states were urged to be part of the International Convention to suppress terrorism financing, as well as regional or international agreements and actions to combat terrorism and their financing. Internally, countries have been instituted to criminalize the FT, to adopt FLS, prevention and detection measures of the FT in financial entities, such as banks and insurers, and non-finances, such as casinos, real estate agencies or pledge stores. To adopt new international instruments that harmonize or even standardize the practices of various states, and agree on their content, it may take years. But Faft was in the right place and moment. Given its informal nature and flexibility to adjust your mandate due to the threats that could exist in the financial system and its technical know-how, the FATF incorporated in its mandate the fight against FT and produced recommendations, at a time when this matter was new to most jurisdictions. The FATF acted quickly, useful and efficiently to the international community. It had experienced experts in the financial area and the ability to assist in the application [of the recommendations] and supervise its execution. The same happened in 2009, following the 2008 financial crisis and the G20 request to reinforce measures intended for transparency and combat corruption. Therefore, it has been a positive way. Argues that the Faft occurred in Faft an “institutional metamorphosis” in this body. As? The FAFT was created as an informal group of technical and temporary, renewable every eight years, but over 30 years has become an increasingly complex organization, governing 206 jurisdictions today. The extension of the mandate also implied the evolution of its powers and responsibilities, and today the FATF is worldwide recognized as the international authority on this matter. It is endowed with a public power of world governance whose recognition is translated into several resolutions of the UN Security Council. The study clarifies FAFT's legal statute. What status is this and what is the connection with other entities also linked to the fight against FT and money laundering? FAFT is the world authority responsible for setting international standards, rules and policies on these subjects and there is no duplication of functions with other international organizations and entities, including International Monetary Fund (IMF), the World Bank and the European Union. This study argues that the gradual evolution of the mandate, the FATF's institutional structure and 'modus operandi' has changed its 'modus constiti'. That is, an organization can evolve into an international organization of full right, regardless of the initial intention of the members and not being created by a treaty. How do you explain that, to date, it is lacking clarification of the FAFT legal statute? I think there was never a real interest in analyzing this issue in depth. This theme was addressed between 2016 and 2018, during the Spanish and Argentine FATF Presidencies, but was “Marinar”, with the argument that there would be a advantage of maintaining a flexible entity to more easily be able to respond to emerging challenges and risks against safety, transparency and integrity of the international financial system. But the fact is that the FATF began to stop and exercise enormous power, as it evaluates and identifies non-compliant jurisdictions, naming them in lists ('Blacklisting'). It may also install measures to members and non -members, a power detained by very few international organizations. To what extent does your recommendations impact and put into practice? FATF recommendations have impact because countries are regularly evaluated on their application, called the “Technical Compliance”, and the effectiveness of their practical application, with the designation of “immediate outcomes”. This assessment is made according to strict criteria, being given a classification. If the result is disabled, the jurisdiction has to make a high level of resolution political commitment to these deficiencies, becoming part of the 'gray list', subject to an action plan and a term [compliance]. In the absence of political commitment or lack of sufficient progress in the execution of the plan, jurisdiction can be appointed to the 'blacklist', and the FATF may appeal to all FATF network jurisdictions to advise their financial institutions to reinforce diligence measures regarding the risks associated with such a jurisdiction. This is what has been happening to Myanmar since October 2022. If jurisdiction has serious deficiencies or does not comply with the action plan or is not a member of a regional group, it can be appointed to the 'blacklist'. In this case, the FATF may appeal to apply the 'Recommendation 19' measures, ranging from reinforcing the diligence and systematic communication of transactions and operations involving jurisdiction to the limitation or prohibition of financial transactions with jurisdiction.
Are there some concrete examples? This happens with Iran and North Korea two decades ago. The international reputation [from this measure to a country] is real, has a political and economic cost. A 2021 International Monetary Fund (IMF) study reveals that the estimated negative effects of 7.6 percent of gross domestic product in capital flows and a significant reduction in foreign direct investment in the jurisdictions in the 'gray list' and may even have consequences on IMF loan conditions. It raises, in the book, the question of the importance of FAFT in the global institutional landscape. What importance is this? FAFT serves as an institutional, operational and regime model for other international organizations. This study develops a theoretical model that can be used in any organization that acts on the international scene, gathers the same objective elements and whose legal status is uncommon. In the background, the FATF is a practical case. International law is not static and one has to analyze reality and adjust the models, and they must reflect the objective reality of the international legal order. China and Hong Kong are members of FAFT. What is the relationship of MSAR and local policies to combat FT and money laundering with this entity? MSAR is a member of one of the FATF regional groups-the Asia-Pacific Group to combat capital bleaching (APG), and obeys the recommendations and mechanisms of FATF supervision, exercised by APG. Macau has had a good performance, obviously fulfilling his recommendations. This happened, for example, with the adoption of the property freezing regime and the law of transmitting control control of cash and negotiable instruments to the bearer. Incidentally, the MSAR was the world's first jurisdiction to obtain the best technical compliance note compared to the 40 FATF recommendations when it was evaluated in 2017. What are the main challenges that FAFT currently faces in combating this type of crimes? The use of new technologies, virtual currency and limited access to formal financial services leading to the use of unregulated channels, increasing the risks of capital bleaching and FT. In the book also speak of the economic pit and response or action capacity between FATF's member jurisdictions regarding the member jurisdictions of regional groups. Many of them are fragile or low -income economies, so it is not surprising that they have more disabilities or difficulties in complying with FATF international standards. In APG, by way of example, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar, Nepal, Timor-Leste and Tuvalu are on the World Bank list of 2023 of the least developed countries, which makes the uniform and global application of FATF standards and policies difficult. In addition, the standards, policies, evaluation procedures and recommendations or FATF action plans are poorly flexible or adjustable to the local reality and internal and regional conditionalisms of non -FATF member jurisdictions. A more equitable participation or representation of these jurisdictions in the final decision -making process of the FATF should also be ensured in order to increase its legitimacy and transparency.

item.title: Interview | Shan Hai Jing, a museum and the appetite of the old
item.description: An interview with the duo of authors of the next English language publication Shan Hai Jing Code 《上古文明密码》, which today Macau has already presented, but now becomes a museum. Michael Du & Julie Oyang, the authors are currently organizing a breathless textual race through the most important piece of Chinese literature and the heaviest treasure of Chinese culture and… beyond. Julie Oyang is an art and culture critique based on Europe, commentator of Chinese culture and visual philosopher. He is a guest professor at the University of São José in Macau, China. Michael Du is a knowledgeable of the Ancient Chinese Canadian culture, holding the largest collection of Hongshan civilization in the world. He is the founder of Haikou Kiwen International Art & Culture Co. Ltd. (海口啓運國際文化藝術品有限公司) and Kiwen International Cultural Exchange (Yantai) Co.ltd (国际文化交流（烟台）有限公司). Both authors are closely involved in the operation of the China Museum of Art for Pre-Dinastic Civilizations (华夏上古文明艺术馆), which will soon open in Yantai, China. Q: In part I of the interview, we talked about the historical meaning of the former Chinese manuscript Shan Hai Jing 《山海经》, also known as the Book of Mountains and Seas, especially its universality. What follows? Michael: We have talked about how a deeper study of Shan Hai Jing can help us understand the origin of the first human civilizations on Earth. But we are makers. We are not for the written pages: we want to ensure that Shan Hai Jing is relevant and alive and making it part of the current culture. With this objective, I found a new company. Kiwen International Cultural Exchange (Yantai) Co.ltd (启运国际文化交流（烟台）有限公司) was created after Haikou Kiwen International Art & Culture Co. Ltd. (海口啓運國際文化藝術品有限公司) is the place where global investigation will take place and the global exchange of knowledge will be encouraged and stimulated in the form of international delegations and high level visitors. We know so little about the old ones, there are so many questions to ask… Julie: In fact, there is so much to do. There is so much we can do. In collaboration with the Chinese government, we are both involved in the operation of the China Museum of Art for Pre-Dinastic Civilizations (华夏上古文明艺术馆), where Michael cures his own collection of artifacts, as well as privately renowned private collections, including all pre-doinestic civilizations such as Hongshan, Liangzhu, Shanxingui, HongShuihe, Shijiahe, etc. These art objects have never been exposed and were never explained by traditional historians. We understand that it is extremely important for us to provide private collectors a place where they can show their journey dedicated to seeking answers to questions about humanity. In this sense, the China Museum of Art for Pre-Dinastic Civilizations (华夏上古文明艺术馆), which should open in Yantai in April, is a unique and brilliant view. We even have the architecture to correspond to this vision. Our goal is to educate the global public in general, as well as establish a connection with the young audience in a fun way and with high quality standards. Beyond the exhibition, which will do more to make the mysterious old “alive and active” to the global audience? Julie: At this time, Michael and I are planning a parallel exhibition and a workshop in collaboration with French artist chef Gil Gonzalez-Foerster (Chinese name: 晓松). In a way, the Yantai museum is a time capsule where an old and faded memory is stored. And Gil's kitchen deals with memory, this time from these pre-Dinastic civilizations, starting from Shan Hai Jing. Being the imaginative guardian of memory, the Chinese classic contains the oldest memory in China, or even in the world. Shan Hai Jing records ancient memories in the form of mythology meditations and the most interesting facts about flora and fauna known for their magical power and powerful force that live from one extreme to the other. This seems to be the reputation of this ancient and inexhaustible text. But Shan Hai Jing is also an extraordinary recipe book! But why food? Michael: You are what you eat. Food is an essential part of everyday human life that can tell us more about the past. When a dish is no longer remembered, part of us cease to exist. Food is perhaps the most intimate and sensual memory. Perhaps this is one of the reasons why Shan Hai Jing was written: remember through food? Our curated exhibition will become more complete, more 3D, more realistic, exploring the taste of the ancients! Julie: Shan Hai Jing documents diverse gastronomic experiences, mixing natural history and food knowledge. His humanist approach makes Shan Hai Jing unique in his genre. The word Shi (食), “eat”, appears more than 160 times in the book, of the ancients. There are, however, many cases about exotic food that heals medical conditions quite familiar to modern men, but Shan Hai Jing also offers cure for conditions such as arrogance, confusion/lack of wisdom, ward off physical dangers. This is a unique culinary philosophy! Food involves the mind, not just the taste. To provoke the intellect. This deep idea is still deeply rooted in modern Chinese food. Through our exhibition, we also understand why Confucius taught his disciples that food is a virtuous gift and why the great Chinese scholarly poets were famous food lovers. We currently do not know who was the author of the mysterious Chinese classic whose imagination exceeds a thousand and one nights… Michael: The ancients were "men of appetite." Appetite can explain humanity's historical and economic landscapes more clearly than academic jargon. Speaking of economics, how is the museum economy managed? Michael: The museum is an educational organism. It is also a business. We focused on five volumes of business. The investigation mainly involves cooperation with various institutions and training programs in China. We organize courses, events and publications. This part will generate 7.6 million RMB/year. Ticket sales will generate 7.2 million RMB/year. Authenticity certification will generate 3.5 million RMB/year. We will also form art and antique auctions agents, whose program will generate 4.9 million RMB/year. In spring and fall, a large scale auction will be held, with a conservative estimate of 50 million RMB of auction volume. This amount does not include revenues from the commission of 15% of sellers and buyers. In addition, four more themed auction games will be held annually, with a conservative estimate of 5 million RMB of business volume and 6 million RMB of auctioning commission.

item.title: António Queirós, philosopher and academic: “the West there is great ignorance” about China
item.description:
Doctorate in Philosophy of Sciences, Environmental and Environmental Ethics, António Queirós, linked to the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon, regrets that the West continues to face China in the wrong way, especially in environmental issues. HM talked to António Queirós before the lecture on the subject he gave yesterday at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center in Lisbon
Will talk about the theme “The Environmental Crisis and the China Eco-Civilization Project”. What project is this? This is China's great project for the New Age. It is a concept that began to be elaborated from 2013. This idea began to be realized with different projects. Since the “New Democracy” regime, which resulted from the Chinese resistance to the occupation of Japan and the geopolitical confrontation of the countries of the axis of different democracies. This is when the Popular Republic of China is proclaimed, such as the proclamation of the “new democracy” and comes the awareness of the world's environmental crisis by China, with the regime to evolve into the so-called “ecological socialism” from 2003. It was necessary for the country to experience a model of industrialization common to the early experiences of socialism, and above all capitalist countries. China's fundamental thesis is that all regimes can collaborate in building a new civilization, but this implies outdoor democratic reforms that are consigned in global civilization proposals, guaranteeing peace according to the principle of indivisibility of security. But I would like to point out the moment when the United Nations (UN), representing the whole world, became aware of the existence of an environmental crisis, from the Stockholm Conference, which took place in 1972. In China this process of awareness of the socialist state organs, citizens and parties, began in 2003. It is strange that issues like this will never be debated. The ideological confrontation that comes from the Cold War did not cease with Helsinquia's agreements, and therefore there are themes that are unknown to the West because of this harmful tradition of the Cold War, which has extended, and because the media have no openness to discuss and present the proposals that China makes. China is present and is an important actor in world meetings on environment and climate. Why do you understand that there is no discussion the West about the concept of eco-civilization? It is not discussed why the West there is great ignorance about China and the reality of the country. The only advantage I have about most people who write and talk about China is that my relationship with the country is over 50 years old. I know how China was presented to the West 50 years ago. We lived [in Portugal], a fascist regime where information came to people with great difficulty. I have seen these years to all kinds of visions about China that lacked concrete information, because the country, until reform and openness, was a closed society. But this lack of information was general in the West. I also had visions that were not reality and I began to question whether China's historical experience is unique, without parallel in the history of society, democracy and socialism, for its historical characteristics, hermeneutics, in the sense of method, the analysis of concepts and starting points, which predominates the West, does not serve. But then let's go to the concrete issue, which is the responsibilities that China has in environmental matters. Which, specifically, are… One thing is the contribution that give China, India and other countries to global warming, because they are populations that represent most of humanity. There are technologies that are themselves polluting. But if we look at this angle we ended up falsifying reality, because greenhouse gases that exist in the atmosphere have been at least 150 years ago due to European and American industrialization. In terms of historical responsibility, the US is largely responsible [for global warming], and I cite official European Union data, for example. I speak of tons of carbon dioxide and greenhouse gases emitted to the atmosphere in all these years. Because they industrialized much earlier than China. Yes, and presented an industry without this kind of environmental concerns. Therefore, this reality is hidden, which greenhouse gases have begun to pollute for 150 years and that it is not only today's contributions [which are the major causes of global warming]. Therefore, the idea that China is the main polluting country finds it wrong. In current terms China and India can be the most polluting. But they are neither in “per capita” nor historically. What is really [in the Western discourse] is that they currently contribute [to global warming]. But then we have to see the trends where we are going to walk. But if we deepen this topic we have come to even less favorable conclusions to Western policies. China's environmental history can be summed up at four periods. The first period is in the years of reform and openness, from 1978, and the fourth period is when China launches the pilot projects of ecological civilization. The process is global. Still in relation to China's responsibilities, in the first phase the West and the industrialized east carried to China the most polluting industries, because China's appeal was to industrialize and create more employment. The UN resolution that adds an article beyond the 30 articles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, finally recognizes as an inalienable right of the human being to a healthy environment.
